o.a:
01 kelime he,05 she, it.
—o
—Old ol
— Proto *ol “demonstrative adjective and third person singular pronoun”

ağrı.a:
15 pain, ache.
—Ottoman أغری
— Middle ağrı
— Old ağrığ
— Proto *ağrığ
— Proto *ağrı- *+(U)ğ
— Proto ağrı-
— Proto *ağrı-
It is common for the U vowel that gets stuck in between to disappear.
— Proto *ağıźı-
— Proto *ağıźı +I-
— Proto *ağıźı “mouth; feeding and vocal organ”
— Proto *ağ- *+(U)ź
— Proto *ağ-

uymak.a:
(intransitive) to follow, to go with.

— Middle uy-
Standard /ḏ/ → /y/ transformation.
— Old uγ-
— Proto *uγ- “to follow”

+(U)z.a:
As observed in the word “ikiz”, it derives plural nouns by attaching to the noun. It is extremely rare. Perhaps, among the words it derives too are “biz” and “siz”.

II. A suffix left over from primitive times that functions to produce nouns from verbs. It has lost its functionality today.

iz.a:
footmark, scar.
— Old iz
Standard /ɨ/ → /z/ transformation.
— Proto *iɨ “footprint”
— Proto *i- *+(U)ɨ
— Proto *i-
Standard /ğ/ → /∅/ transformation.
— Proto *iğ- “to walk”
